Posts.Content: nurseronda10 wrote: This is all new to me and very scary.  Got the dreaded phone call Wednesday from my gynecologist saying the pathology report from my ultrasound guided needle biopsy showed infiltrating mammary carcinoma.  I have an appointment Monday with a surgeon.  I have ready many, many posts on this website and have found them to be very informative.  Is it routine to get a PET scan or will I have to insist on one?   I have two full coverage insurances, so there shouldn't be any problems there.  The nodule on ultrasound measured 4 mm.  Does anyone know if mammary is the same as ductal?  Any help will be appreciated.   Dx 8/25/2010, IDC, 1cm, Stage II, Grade 2, 1/8 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2+ Surgery 9/13/2010 Lymph node removal: Left, Underarm/Axillary; Mastectomy: Left Targeted Therapy 10/27/2010 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Chemotherapy 10/27/2010 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxotere (docetaxel) Hormonal Therapy 4/15/2011 Arimidex (anastrozole) Surgery 3/7/2012 Reconstruction (left): Latissimus dorsi flap, Tissue expander placement Surgery 3/7/2012 Prophylactic mastectomy: Right; Reconstruction (right): Tissue expander placement Surgery 6/13/2012 Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Log in to post a reply
